If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even n → Even a → Even (n % a)
name: Even.mod_even
docString: If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

For any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is a divisor of itself.

name: Nat.mem_divisors_self
docString: For any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is a divisor of itself.

This theorem states that for any integer `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0. In other words, an integer `n` satisfies the property `Even`--meaning there exists some other integer `r` such that `n = r + r`--if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is 0. This is a formalization of the usual mathematical definition of even numbers in the integers.

name: Int.even_iff
docString: This theorem states that for any integer `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0. In other words, an integer `n` satisfies the property `Even`--meaning there exists some other integer `r` such that `n = r + r`--if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is 0. This is a formalization of the usual mathematical definition of even numbers in the integers.

If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Even (n % a) ↔ Even n)
name: Even.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

name: Int.even_iff
docString: An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, `n` is even if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 equals 0. In other words, this theorem provides a condition to check the evenness of a number in terms of a modular arithmetic operation. Specifically, a natural number `n` satisfies `Even n` (meaning there exists a natural number `r` such that `n = r + r`) if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals zero.

name: Nat.even_iff
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, `n` is even if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 equals 0. In other words, this theorem provides a condition to check the evenness of a number in terms of a modular arithmetic operation. Specifically, a natural number `n` satisfies `Even n` (meaning there exists a natural number `r` such that `n = r + r`) if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals zero.

If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Odd (n % a) ↔ Odd n)
name: Odd.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Odd n → Even a → Odd (n % a)
name: Odd.mod_even
docString: If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

name: Nat.evenOddStrongRec

`n : ℕ` is perfect if and only the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is `n` and `n`
is positive.

name: Nat.Perfect
docString:
`n : ℕ` is perfect if and only the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is `n` and `n`
is positive.

`n : ℕ` is _abundant_ if the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is greater than `n`.

name: Nat.Abundant
docString: `n : ℕ` is _abundant_ if the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is greater than `n`.

If for all `n ≠ 0 ∈ ℤ`, `n • A = A`, then `A` is divisible.

type: (A : Type u_1) → [inst : AddCommGroup A] → (∀ {n : ℤ}, n ≠ 0 → n • ⊤ = ⊤) → DivisibleBy A ℤ
name: AddCommGroup.divisibleByIntOfSMulTopEqTop
docString: If for all `n ≠ 0 ∈ ℤ`, `n • A = A`, then `A` is divisible.

`div2 n = ⌊n/2⌋` the greatest integer smaller than `n/2`

name: Nat.div2
docString: `div2 n = ⌊n/2⌋` the greatest integer smaller than `n/2`

A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime q → q % 4 = 3 → Even (padicValNat q n)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff
docString:
A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

`boddDiv2 n` returns a 2-tuple of type `(Bool, Nat)` where the `Bool` value indicates whether
`n` is odd or not and the `Nat` value returns `⌊n/2⌋`

name: Nat.boddDiv2
docString:
`boddDiv2 n` returns a 2-tuple of type `(Bool, Nat)` where the `Bool` value indicates whether
`n` is odd or not and the `Nat` value returns `⌊n/2⌋`

If `n` is a nonzero natural number and `p ≠ 1`, then there are natural numbers `e`
and `n'` such that `n'` is not divisible by `p` and `n = p^e * n'`.

name: Nat.exists_eq_pow_mul_and_not_dvd
docString:
If `n` is a nonzero natural number and `p ≠ 1`, then there are natural numbers `e`
and `n'` such that `n'` is not divisible by `p` and `n = p^e * n'`.

There are exactly `⌊N/n⌋` positive multiples of `n` that are `≤ N`.
See `Nat.card_multiples` for a "shifted-by-one" version.

type: ∀ (N n : ℕ), (Finset.filter (fun k => k ≠ 0 ∧ n ∣ k) (Finset.range N.succ)).card = N / n
name: Nat.card_multiples'
docString:
There are exactly `⌊N/n⌋` positive multiples of `n` that are `≤ N`.
See `Nat.card_multiples` for a "shifted-by-one" version.

If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m ^ n) ↔ Even m ∧ n ≠ 0
name: Nat.even_pow
docString:
If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`.

name: Nat.add_two_le_nth_prime
docString: The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`.

In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} {k : Fin n}, Even k ↔ Odd n ∨ Even ↑k
name: Fin.even_iff
docString:
In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

`n : ℕ` is _deficient_ if the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is less than `n`.

name: Nat.Deficient
docString: `n : ℕ` is _deficient_ if the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is less than `n`.

For any two elements `x`, `y` such that `1 < y`, there exists a natural number `n`
such that `x ≤ y ^ n`.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} {inst : OrderedCommMonoid α} [self : MulArchimedean α] (x : α) {y : α}, 1 < y → ∃ n, x ≤ y ^ n
name: MulArchimedean.arch
docString:
For any two elements `x`, `y` such that `1 < y`, there exists a natural number `n`
such that `x ≤ y ^ n`.

A positive natural number `n` is _pseudoperfect_ if there exists a subset of the proper
divisors of `n` such that the sum of that subset is equal to `n`.

name: Nat.Pseudoperfect
docString:
A positive natural number `n` is _pseudoperfect_ if there exists a subset of the proper
divisors of `n` such that the sum of that subset is equal to `n`.

Multiplication modulo `n`

type: {n : ℕ} → Fin n → Fin n → Fin n
name: Fin.mul
docString: Multiplication modulo `n`
